·48·
SE&ydot;nt laurence Laurence guod man wa&slong; &punctelev; and in &slong;trong Mart&ydot;rdom martyrdom
he endede here on eo&rrot;þe is lijf &punctelev; and to þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heuene he com
Decius þe Aumperour &punctelev; þat luþur wa&slong; inovȝ
And is Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise
Valerian &punctelev; þat to alle schrewehede d&rrot;ovȝ
hu&ydot; wenden and &slong;ouȝten cri&slong;tine Men men &punctelev; and ȝwane hu&ydot; enie founde
hu&ydot; pineden heom with gret to&rrot;ment &punctelev; and b&rrot;ouȝten heom &slong;one to grounde
hu&ydot; comenen comen and founden þene bi&slong;chop &slong;ixte Sixte &punctelev; and a&slong;lowen him with gret wouȝ
Seint laurence Laurence wa&slong; is Ercedeckne ercedeckne &punctelev; þat guod man wa&slong; inovȝ
¶þo þe bi&slong;chop &slong;cholde beon inome &punctelev; and he þat cas iseiȝ
Seint laurence Laurence is Ercedeckne ercedeckne &punctelev; he cleopede þat wa&slong; him neiȝ
·48·
Al þat tre&slong;o&rrot; of holie churche &punctelev; þat he togadere d&rrot;ovȝ
Seint laurence Laurence he it bitok &punctelev; to witien it wel inovȝ
þe to&rrot;mento&rrot;e&slong; þat þis i&slong;eiȝen &punctelev; heom boþe hu&ydot; nome fa&slong;te
Seint &slong;ixte Sixte and &slong;eint laurence Laurence &punctelev; and &slong;trongue biende&slong; on heom ca&slong;te
hu&ydot; ladden &slong;eint &slong;ixte Sixte to heo&rrot;e fal&slong;e gode&slong; &punctelev; and is tweie felawe&slong; als&slong;
And &slong;cheweden heom heo&rrot;e fal&slong;e h&ydot;mage&slong; &punctelev; and beden heom aloute þarto
Þo þis guode men nolden don &slong;o &punctelev; ake on o&rrot;e louerd hu&ydot; crieden fa&slong;te
hu&ydot; &slong;miten of heo&rrot;e heuede&slong; &slong;one &punctelev; and heo&rrot;e bodie&slong; þare ca&slong;te
Þe Aumperoure hu&ydot; &slong;enden wo&rrot;d &punctelev; al ȝwat hu&ydot; hadden ido
And hov &slong;eint laurence Laurence in p&rrot;i&slong;one was &punctelev; in &slong;trongue bende&slong; al&slong;o
And hou he al þat tre&slong;o&rrot; hadde &punctelev; of churchene to him id&rrot;awe
Þe Aumperouv Aumperovr iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; he wa&slong; glad þarof and fawe
Fo&rrot; he þouȝte þat tre&slong;o&rrot; al habbe &punctelev; þei it were aȝen lawe
¶Þane holie Man man he liet fette &punctelev; and bifo&rrot;e him lede
And biheold him wel &slong;tu&ydot;&rrot;neliche &punctelev; and wo&rrot;tþeliche wrotþeliche to him &slong;ede
Ȝware is þat tre&slong;o&rrot; of þe churchene &punctelev; þat þe wa&slong; ib&rrot;ouȝt
Seint laurence Laurence &slong;tod wel &slong;tille &punctelev; and ne an&slong;uredede ansuerede him riȝt nouȝt
Þe Aumperour wa&slong; &slong;wiþe wroth &punctelev; þo he ne ȝaf him non An&slong;were answere
Anon he wolde habbe defouled him &punctelev; vnneþe he it niȝte fo&rrot;bere
he liet cleopie valerian Valerian &punctelev; þat was is heiȝe Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise
Nim he &slong;eide þeo&slong;ne Man man &punctelev; wel fa&slong;te in alle wi&slong;e
And win of him þat tre&slong;o&rrot; &punctelev; and make him don &slong;acrefi&slong;e
Oþur b&rrot;ing him in &slong;wuch to&rrot;ment &punctelev; þat oþure of him agri&slong;e
Þe Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise nam þene holie Man man &punctelev; and liet him binde fa&slong;te
And bitok him &ydot;polite Ypolite þe kn&ydot;ȝt &punctelev; In in &slong;trong p&rrot;i&slong;one to ca&slong;te
he b&rrot;ouȝte
him in &slong;trong p&rrot;isoun &punctelev; and bilek him fa&slong;te al&slong;o
with þeoue&slong; and with luþere Men men &punctelev; þat hadden þe Aumperoure mi&slong;do
On heþene man þare was Inne inne &punctelev; lucille Lucille wa&slong; is name
Þat hadde þareinne &slong;o muche iwope &punctelev; fo&rrot; &slong;eo&rrot;uwe and fo&rrot; &slong;chame
Þat he weop out boþe is eiȝene &punctelev; and al bl&ydot;nd wa&slong; bicome
Seint laurence Laurence hadde reuþe &punctelev; þat is &slong;iȝt him wa&slong; binome
bilief he &slong;eide on Ie&slong;u cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat fo&rrot; us &slong;chedde is blod
And afong cri&slong;tinedom &punctelev; ant þov &slong;chalt habbe þi &slong;iȝt wel guod
Ich bilieue þis oþur &slong;eide &punctelev; on him with al mi þouȝt
And fo&rrot;&slong;ake alle þeos fal&slong;e godes &punctelev; þat ne mowen me helpe nouȝt
¶Seint laurence Laurence baptizede him &punctelev; and anonriȝt with þe dede
his &slong;iȝt him cam wel cler and guod &punctelev; þo bigan he anon to grede
Ihered beo &slong;wete Iesu cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat here hath icud is miȝte
And þo&rrot;uȝ is &slong;eriaunt seint laurence Laurence &punctelev; me hath i&slong;ent mi &slong;iȝte
Fo&rrot; a&slong;e ȝe wuten euerechone &punctelev; mi &slong;iȝt me wa&slong; binome
And þo&rrot;uȝ Ie&slong;u cri&slong;t and &slong;eint laurence Laurence &punctelev; it is me aȝein icome
Þis t&ydot;þingue &slong;p&rrot;ong &slong;one wide &punctelev; so þat oþo&rrot;e inowe
Þat wide aboute blinde weren &punctelev; þuderward fa&slong;te hu&ydot; d&rrot;owe
¶Þo &ydot;polite Ypolite þis i&slong;aiȝ &punctelev; þat o&rrot;e louerd hadde &slong;wuch miȝte
Þat alle þe blinde þat þudere comen &punctelev; anon hadden heo&rrot;e &slong;iȝte
·48· 148
Merci he criede &slong;eint laurence Laurence &punctelev; and to Iu&slong;u Iesu
cri&slong;t Crist him nam
And he and al is ma&ydot;nie &punctelev; nomen cri&slong;tinedom
Ualerian þareafterward &slong;one &punctelev; a&slong;e it cam in is þouȝte
Sende to &ydot;polite Ypolite
þe kn&ydot;ȝt &punctelev; þat he &slong;eint laurence Laurence him b&rrot;ouȝte
Nov laurence Laurence quath &ydot;polite Ypolite &punctelev; fo&rrot;th ich mot þe lede
Ȝe go we fo&rrot;th &slong;eide laurence Laurence &punctelev; ne &slong;chal us noþing d&rrot;ede
Þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene is alȝare &punctelev; to u&slong; boþe in alle wi&slong;e
Þo ladde
&ydot;polite Ypolite
laurence Laurence fo&rrot;th &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e þe luþere Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise
Valerian þe Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise &punctelev; biheold laurence Laurence fa&slong;te
And &slong;eide bel ami hov longue &punctelev; &slong;chal ower folie ila&slong;te
Tu&ydot;rn þi þouȝt ich rede &slong;one &punctelev; and &slong;chewe us þat tre&slong;our
Of churchene þat þe was bitake &punctelev; and deliuere it þe Aumperour
¶Sire Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise seint laurence Laurence &slong;eide &punctelev; ȝif þov onder&slong;tan&slong;t re&slong;oun
Þov wo&slong;t wel þat ich habbe ile&ydot;e &punctelev; longue in þat p&rrot;i&slong;oun
So þat i ne habbe nouȝt þat tre&slong;o&rrot; &punctelev; of churche here nov ȝare
Ake ȝif me þ&rrot;eo dawe&slong; fur&slong;t &punctelev; þat ich mouwe aboute fare
And ich it wolle togadere b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; and here bifo&rrot;e þe lede
Þo wa&slong; þe Iu&slong;ti&slong;e iustise &slong;w&ydot;þe glad &punctelev; of wo&rrot;de&slong; þat he &slong;ede
Fo&rrot; hope opf þat grete tre&slong;o&rrot; &punctelev; and fo&rrot; none oþur þur
þingue
he ȝaf him re&slong;pit of þ&rrot;eo dawe&slong; &punctelev; þat tre&slong;o&rrot; fo&rrot;th to b&rrot;ingue
And bitok him &ydot;polite Ypolite in warde &punctelev; þat he him aȝein b&rrot;ouȝte
Fo&rrot;th hu&ydot; wenden wide aboute &punctelev; and guod tre&slong;o&rrot; hu&ydot; &slong;ouȝte
Alle þe men þat hu&ydot; miȝten finde &punctelev; þat pouere and feble were
In &slong;icne&slong;&slong;e oþur in mi&slong;ei&slong;e &punctelev; togadere hu&ydot; b&rrot;ouȝten þere
And in &ydot;politu&slong; Ypolitus hou&slong;e hudden heom &punctelev; And and wenden to þe Aumperour
Þe Aumperour heom Axede axede &slong;one &punctelev; ȝware were þat tre&slong;our
¶Sire &slong;eide &slong;eint laurence Laurence &punctelev; redi it is anon
he wende out after þe &slong;elie Men men &punctelev; and bad heom with him gon
Into þe palais he ladde heom fo&rrot;th &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e þe AumperourHorstmann believes that the fourth letter of "palais" was an "a" overwritten with an "e". It certainly looks like one letter is written over the other, but it is not possible to tell what the original letters was. The "a" spelling is selected here because it is the more visible of the two letters.
Lo &slong;ire he &slong;eide ich habbe ib&rrot;ouȝt &punctelev; holi churche tre&slong;our
Þis tre&slong;our is &slong;wiþe holi and guod &punctelev; and euere it wole ila&slong;te
hit ne &slong;chal neuere wanie &punctelev; ake euere wexe fa&slong;te
In eche londe it is redi &punctelev; ȝwodere&slong;o ani man wiende
Þarewith Man man ma&ydot; þe bli&slong;&slong;e of heouene &punctelev; bugge withouten ende
Ei traitre &slong;eide þe Aumperour &punctelev; is it icome hereto
ha&slong;t þov us þus to &slong;co&rrot;n id&rrot;iue &punctelev; þov ne &slong;chalt nonmo&rrot;e so
he liet him &slong;treope nakede anon &punctelev; and with &slong;marte &slong;courgene him bete
Þat blod o&rrot;n bi is lime&slong; adoun &punctelev; boþe in lengþe and in grete
Þo &slong;eide þis holie man &punctelev; louerd ich þonkie þe
Þat among þine holie compa&ydot;nie &punctelev; þi wille is to b&rrot;ingue me
And þov wrechche luþere þing &punctelev; þov art in gret to&rrot;ment iwis
In wrathþe and &slong;o&rrot;uwe of heo&rrot;te &punctelev; and neuere þe wo&rrot;&slong;e me nis
A tra&ydot;tour &slong;eide þis luþere Man man &punctelev; neltþov nonoþur &slong;ingue
Alle manere of to&rrot;menz &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e him he liet b&rrot;ingue
Hoke&slong; of · Ire ire · and ȝweole&slong; al&slong;o &punctelev; with ra&slong;o&rrot;e&slong; alaboute
·48·
And a bed of Ire ire with kene pikes &punctelev; al b&rrot;enninde withoute
Scourgene of led and raketeiȝe&slong; &punctelev; and oþere wel mani on
Þat we ne conne nouȝt alle tellen &punctelev; on eo&rrot;þe nouþe nis &slong;wuch non non The scribe appears to have written the final "n" of the line around a small hole in the parchment.
Lo seide þe Aum&pbardes;our Aumperour &punctelev; bihold nouþe alaboute
And honovre o&rrot;e gode&slong; ich rede anon &punctelev; oþur herto þov &slong;chalt loute
Fo&rrot; alle þe to&rrot;menz þat þov i&slong;ixt &punctelev; and ȝeot wel mo þerto
bote þov tu&ydot;&rrot;ne þi þouȝt anon &punctelev; on þi bodi &slong;chullen beo ido
¶Þov wrechche &slong;eide þis holie man &punctelev; mi wille hath euere ibeo
Fo&rrot;to come to þis murie &slong;olas &punctelev; þat ich here nouþe i&slong;eo
Wel mo to&rrot;menz þane here beoth &punctelev; to þe beoth imad alȝare
In þe pine of helle &punctelev; ȝwane ich &slong;chal to þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heuene fare
Decius þe Aumperour þo &punctelev; fierde a&slong;e he were wod
Þe compa&ydot;nie of to&rrot;mento&rrot;e&slong; &punctelev; wel p&rrot;e&slong;t bifo&rrot;e him &slong;tod
he het heom with grete &slong;taues &punctelev; leggen on him to grounde
Þe to&rrot;mento&rrot;e&slong; leiden on him &punctelev; and maden him mani a wounde
A&slong;e hu&ydot; beoten þis holie bodi &punctelev; seint laurence Laurence him &slong;ede
Þou w&rrot;echche nouþe þov miȝt i&slong;eo &punctelev; þat I nabbe of þe no d&rrot;ede
Nimez anon quath þe Aumperour &punctelev; and makiez is to&rrot;ment mo&rrot;e
Wel redie weren þe sch&rrot;ewe&slong; alle &punctelev; to don aftur is lo&rrot;e
Irene plate&slong; al b&rrot;enninde &punctelev; In in is wounde&slong; hu&ydot; duden &slong;o &slong;o&rrot;e
Swete louerd þis holi man &slong;eide &punctelev; ich bidde þe milce and o&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; þo ich wa&slong; harde acoupet &punctelev; I ne fo&rrot;&slong;ok þe nouȝt
Ake þo me Axeden axeden me ich wa&slong; aknowe·of þe &punctelev; with wo&rrot;de and with þouȝt
Þo deciu&slong; Decius iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; fo&rrot; w&rrot;athþe he gan grede
And liet nime &slong;courgene &punctelev; with grete bottene of lede
And liet beten þis holi man &punctelev; þat is bone&slong; b&rrot;eken &slong;ome
Þat he wa&slong; opon þe pointe of deth &punctelev; and is &slong;trencþe neiȝ binome
¶Louerd he &slong;eide Ie&slong;u cri&slong;t Crist &punctelev; þat þolede&slong;t deth &dblsol;&dblsol;fo&rrot; meThe word "for" int he margin was added later, possibly by a different hand. me
Onderfong ȝwane ich heonne&slong; wiende &punctelev; mine &slong;oule ich bidde þe
Þo cam þare a &slong;wete voiz &punctelev; adoun fram heuene anon
Þat þeo&slong; wo&rrot;de&slong; to him &slong;eide &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; heo&rrot;den echon
¶Þo Deciu&slong; iheo&rrot;de þis &punctelev; fo&rrot; w&rrot;athþe he gradde and wo
Ȝeot þe beoth fo&rrot; gode&slong; Godes loue &punctelev; to&rrot;mento&rrot;e&slong; tormentes to come wel mo
Lo he &slong;eide mine barone&slong; &punctelev; þat mi con&slong;eilere&slong; ȝe beoth
Con&slong;eil nimez hereof in mine court &punctelev; of þingue þat ȝe i&slong;eoth
Ȝe iheo&rrot;ez wel hov þe deuele deuelen
&punctelev; with him &slong;pekez nov here
Fo&rrot; of þing þat ȝe iheo&rrot;ez alle &punctelev; he ne ma&ydot; him nouȝt &slong;kere
hu&ydot; comieth here and confo&rrot;tiez him &punctelev; a&slong;e ȝe iheo&rrot;ez echon
Strong wichche is þat ne doutez &punctelev; of o&rrot;e gode&slong; echon
Wel hardi he is fo&rrot; he ne tellez &punctelev; of alle o&rrot;e to&rrot;menz non
bi þe fei þat ich owe to mahun &punctelev; anoþur it &slong;chal gon
Scourgene he liet nime of Ire ire &punctelev; þat harde weren inovȝ
And is fle&slong;ch þat wa&slong; er bileued &punctelev; þarewith he tognovȝ
Þo is fle&slong;ch þus defouled was &punctelev; þat reovþe it wa&slong; to seo
Þeof he &slong;eide ȝeot þov &slong;chalt &punctelev; In in wel mo&rrot;e to&rrot;ment beo
Laurens ame amen
49 149
his chekene and is mouth aboute &punctelev; he liete bete with &slong;tone&slong;
And da&slong;chte þe tiez out of is heued &punctelev; and tob&rrot;eken is bone&slong;
Þov w&rrote;echche he &slong;eide biþiench þi&slong;eolf &punctelev; and to&rrot;ne &slong;one þi þouȝt
¶Sire Aumperour laurence Laurence &slong;eide &punctelev; þov &slong;pext al embe nouȝt
Inelle honovri none oþur gode&slong; &punctelev; þane Ie&slong;us in none wi&slong;e
Fo&rrot; him ich louie and euere wolle &punctelev; don him &slong;acrefise
Þo Decius him hadde ido &punctelev; al þat he couþe biþenche
Certe&slong; he seide þov &slong;chalt beo ded &punctelev; ne &slong;chalt þov nouȝt &slong;o atblenche
Strong fu&ydot;&rrot; he lieth maken and gret &punctelev; and a gredire þaron &slong;ette
Þene holie Man man seint laurence Laurence &punctelev; þarto he liet fette
And alalong opon þe gredire &punctelev; ouer þe fure him ca&slong;te
Þe to&rrot;mento&rrot;e&slong;t &slong;toden al aboute &punctelev; and bleowen þat fu&ydot;&rrot; wel fa&slong;te
with Irene irene pike&slong; hu&ydot; pulten him &punctelev; and &slong;chouen In in fa&slong;te aboue
Louerd muche was þe p&ydot;ne &punctelev; þat he &slong;offrede fo&rrot; þi loue
Þat fu&ydot;&rrot; bineoþe ro&slong;tede him &punctelev; al quic mid fle&slong;ch and blode
And þe Irene irene pike&slong; in is fle&slong;ch &punctelev; ful bitterliche hu&ydot; wode
Seint laurence Laurence bigan to &slong;peke [þo] &punctelev; and to þe Aumpero&rrot;e he &slong;ede
Þov luþere w&rrot;echche it ne deriez me nouȝt &punctelev; al þine luþere dede
Nim ȝeme þat þine fu&ydot;&rrot;ie cole&slong; &punctelev; wel muche akelez me
And into þe &slong;trongue fu&ydot;&rrot;e of helle &punctelev; hu&ydot; &slong;chullen b&rrot;ingue þe
LOuerd Ie&slong;u cri&slong;t Crist þov it wo&slong;t &punctelev; I ne habbe þe nouȝt fo&rrot;&slong;ake
Ake clanliche mi bodi and al mi þouȝt &punctelev; þe ich habbe bitake
Þo biheold he þene Aumperour &punctelev; with fair semblaunt and louvȝ
Þov w&rrot;echche he &slong;eide þou ha&slong;t iro&slong;ted &punctelev; þulke one &slong;ide inouȝ
To&rrot;ne hire opward and·et·hire nouþe &punctelev; fo&rrot; ȝare heo is þareto
And wiend and ro&slong;te þat oþur &slong;ide &punctelev; þat heo beo inovȝ al&slong;o
¶Þo biheold he up on heiȝ &punctelev; and toward heouene is E&ydot;ene eyene ca&slong;te
And &slong;eide &punctelev; &slong;wete Ie&slong;u c&combtildevert;&slong;t Crist &punctelev; Ich þonki þe wel fa&slong;te
Þat ich it habbe ofserued &punctelev; at þine ȝate&slong; In in to wiende
With þulke wo&rrot;de he deide þo &punctelev; and b&rrot;oute is lijf to ende
&ydot;polit þe guode kn&ydot;ȝt &punctelev; þat he b&rrot;ouȝte to c&combtildevert;&slong;tinedom Cristendom
And þat him wu&slong;te in p&rrot;i&slong;one·er &punctelev; sw&ydot;þe &slong;o&rrot;i bicom
bi niȝte he wende &slong;tilledeliche &punctelev; and þis holie bodi he nom
And burede hit wel &slong;tilledeliche &punctelev; after is harde dom
Louerd muche wa&slong; þe pine &punctelev; þat he þolede here
hit[MS. his] is wel riȝt þat he beo &punctelev; Apo&slong;tle&slong; ifere
Novþe Ie&slong;u fo&rrot; þe grete pine &punctelev; þat seint laurence Laurence here hadde
Vs b&rrot;ingue to þulke Io&ydot;e ioye &punctelev; þat þine Aungels aungels his &slong;oule ladde ·Amen
